source_sentence: 大唐三藏義淨奉　制譯
translation: translated by the Tripiṭaka Master Jīvaka of the Great Tang

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻等：「如過往昔，若依我教者，皆得離大苦難。
translation: The Buddha told the monks and others, As in the past, if they relied on my teaching, they would all be freed from great suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 若依提婆達多者，皆在苦難之中。
translation: If someone relies on Devadatta, they're all in the midst of suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 汝等諦聽！
translation: Listen attentively!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔於曠野中近有一村，其村樹花菓滋茂，隨近有二群猴，一部五百，各有一猴王。
translation: In the distant past, there was a village nearby in the wilderness that had plenty of trees and flowers and fruit. Next to it were two groups of monkeys, one group of five hundred [monkeys] each, each with a king of monkeys.

source_sentence: 其中一王，夢見被五百猿猴擲此二王於熱鑊中。
translation: One of these kings dreamed that he was tossed by five hundred monkeys and two other kings in a hot cauldron.

source_sentence: 於此夢中，生大驚愕，身毛皆竪，便即夢覺。
translation: In this dream, he became so frightened that his body hair stood on end and he immediately woke up in a dream.

source_sentence: 令喚群猴，即說此夢告言：『我今所見夢者，不是好耶？
translation: He summoned the monkeys and said to them, 'Isn't it good that I'm seeing a dream now?'

source_sentence: 我等須棄此居所住之處移往餘處。』
translation: We must abandon this place where we live and move to another place.'

source_sentence: 群猴白言：『如大王所說，當須走離。』
translation: The monkeys said, 'As the great king explains, you must run away.'

source_sentence: 菩薩是大威德，若見夢者必當真實。
translation: The bodhisattva is so great and authoritative that if he sees a dream, it will surely be true.

source_sentence: 其王即喚第二王告言：『我今見如是夢，須往別處住。』
translation: The king then summoned the second king and told him, 'Now that I've seen such a dream, I must go to another place to stay.'

source_sentence: 王難信，告言：『凡所夢見，可即依此信耶？
translation: The king had difficulty believing it and said, 'Should we rely on this faith for whatever dreams we see?'

source_sentence: 汝若欲往，隨意所去。
translation: If you want to go there, go wherever you wish.

source_sentence: 我今於此境界得寬，我終不去。』
translation: Now that I've gained breadth in this realm, I won't go.'

source_sentence: 彼王知其難信，領自管五百群猴，即移餘處。
translation: Knowing that it was difficult to believe, the king took charge of his five hundred groups of monkeys and moved them elsewhere.

source_sentence: 後時於彼村中有一賤婢炒麥，有一羊來至此婢邊，欲食此麥。
translation: Later, there was a lowly maidservant in that village who cooked wheat. A sheep came to the maidservant's side and wanted to eat it.

source_sentence: 其婢即以火燒木打羊，火著身上被燒急已，走入王家象坊。
translation: The maidservant then beat the sheep with a fire that burns wood, puts it on its body and is burned in distress, and walks into the king's elephant hut.

source_sentence: 坊內多有芻草，其羊抖擻身火便落草上，然著草木眾象被燒，其當象人告王。
translation: In the monastery there was a large amount of millet grass, and when the sheep shook their bodies in the fire they fell onto the grass but were burned by the elephants wearing grass and trees, which would then tell the king.

source_sentence: 時王即喚醫人告言：『眾象被燒，爾急作何醫療？』
translation: The king then summoned the doctor and told him, 'The elephants are burned, so what's urgently needed to treat them?'

source_sentence: 時彼醫人便作是念：『往日被群猴損暴我田農，我今得便當須酬冤。』
translation: The doctor then had this thought, 'In the past, I was harmed by a group of monkeys in my field and  farm, and now that I've gotten it, I'll have to repay their enemies.'

source_sentence: 白大王言：『此象被燒，須用猿猴脂塗身，方可得差。』
translation: He said to the great king, 'This elephant is burned; it's only when it's covered with the fat of a monkey that it can be cured.'

source_sentence: 時大王勅諸群臣：『汝等速須訪覓猴脂。』
translation: The great king then commanded his ministers, 'Should you quickly search for the monkey's fat?'

source_sentence: 臣等依命，即喚獵師：『汝等可速覓猴將來。』
translation: Relying on their orders, the ministers and others called to the hunter, 'You must quickly search for the monkey that's coming.'

source_sentence: 獵師依命，即往諸方捕捉猴。
translation: Relying on his orders, the hunter went to various places to capture the monkey.

source_sentence: 彼難信猴王并五百群猴，俱被繫縛將來王所。
translation: That difficult monkey king and the five hundred groups of monkeys were all bound to the king's place in the future.

source_sentence: 其醫人為久結怨恨，將彼猿猴等活擲著於熱鑊之中。
translation: Because of long-standing grudges, the doctor threw those monkeys and others alive into a hot cauldron.

source_sentence: 「『近冤不可住，　　城及村野中；
translation: 'You shouldn't live near enemies, in cities or villages or in wilderness.

source_sentence: 婢嗔羊食麥，　　猴等被銷鎔。』」
translation: The maid is angry with the sheep who eat wheat, and the monkeys and so forth are silenced.'

source_sentence: 爾時諸天即於空中而說頌曰：佛告諸苾芻：「汝等勿作異念！
translation: It was then that the gods spoke a verse in the sky, saying, The Buddha told the monks, Don't have any different thoughts!

source_sentence: 爾時見夢猴王者，即我身是。
translation: At the time, he saw that the monkey king in a dream was me.

source_sentence: 其難信猴王者，提婆達多是。
translation: It's difficult to believe that the monkey king is Devadatta.

source_sentence: 所餘獼猴取我語者，免斯火怖。
translation: The other rhesus monkeys who take my words will be spared the fear of this fire.

source_sentence: 取提婆達多語者，悉遭劇苦。
translation: Those who take Devadatta's words will all experience great suffering.

source_sentence: 今時取我語者，並於生死大怖而得解脫。
translation: Those who now take my words will attain liberation in the great fear of birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 受提婆達多言教者，悉遭苦難。
translation: Those who receive the words and teachings of Devadatta will all experience suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 復次所有隨順我意者，皆得平安遠離苦難。
translation: Furthermore, anyone who follows my wishes will attain peace and be free of suffering.

source_sentence: 隨提婆達多意者，悉遭苦難。
translation: Those who follow Devadatta's advice will all experience suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 「汝等苾芻諦聽！
translation: You monks, listen closely!

source_sentence: 乃往昔時有異方所，有二獼猴王，各有五百眷屬。
translation: Formerly there were two kings of the rhesus monkeys, each with five hundred members of their retinues.

source_sentence: 其中一獼猴王，與五百眷屬遊行人間，至一聚落。
translation: One of them, the rhesus monkey king, accompanied by his five hundred retinues, traveled among the people to a village.

source_sentence: 於此聚落有一金波伽樹，其樹菓實茂盛。
translation: In this village there was a golden lotus tree with abundant fruit and plenty of goods growing from it.

source_sentence: 時諸群猴見此菓樹，白猴王曰：『此樹菓子繁茂，枝將欲折。
translation: When the monkeys saw this fruit tree, they said to the king of the monkeys, 'This tree has plenty of fruit and its branches are about to break down.

source_sentence: 我等遠來疲乏，取其菓食。』
translation: We've come from afar to be exhausted, so we'll take their fruit and food.'

source_sentence: 「『此樹近聚落，　　童子不食菓；
translation: 'This tree is near a village, so the children won't eat fruit.

source_sentence: 汝等應可知，　　此菓不堪食。』
translation: You should know that this fruit is unworthy of food.'

source_sentence: 爾時猴王見斯樹已，遂說頌曰：「說此頌已，諸獼猴等即便捨去。
translation: Seeing this tree, the monkey king then spoke a verse, saying, After speaking this verse, the monkeys and others abandoned it.

source_sentence: 其第二獼猴王，亦與五百眷屬遊行人間，漸至此村。
translation: The second rhesus monkey king also traveled among the people with his five hundred attendants and gradually reached this village.

source_sentence: 是諸獼猴亦入其村，菓實繁茂，便告獼猴王曰：『我等涉路疲勞，欲食其菓安穩而去。』
translation: The monkeys also entered the village, where there were plenty of fruit and goods. They then told the king of the monkeys, 'We're tired from traveling on the road and want to eat that fruit, so we'll leave it safely.'

source_sentence: 獼猴王曰：『善哉！』
translation: The monkey king said, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 爾時五百獼猴即食其菓。
translation: It was then that five hundred monkeys ate the fruit.

source_sentence: 于時諸獼猴等，所食其菓皆悉致死。
translation: The monkeys and others then ate the fruit, and they all died.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻，勿作異念！
translation: You monks, don't think otherwise!

source_sentence: 其不食菓獼猴王者，我身是。
translation: That monkey king who doesn't eat fruit is me, the monkey king.

source_sentence: 其第二獼猴王者，提婆達多是。
translation: The second monkey king was Devadatta.

source_sentence: 隨順我意者，平安得達遠離苦難。
translation: Those who follow my wishes will be safely able to reach them and be far removed from suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 隨提婆達多意者，悉遭苦難。
translation: Those who follow Devadatta's advice will all experience suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 今時諸有情等隨順我語，於生死中而得解脫。
translation: At the present time, sentient beings and so forth who follow my words attain liberation in birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 受提婆達多言教者，悉遭苦難。」
translation: Those who receive the words and teachings of Devadatta will all experience suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 爾時提婆達多，以石欲擊世尊。
translation: It was then that Devadatta wanted to strike the Bhagavān with a stone.

source_sentence: 于時諸婆羅門居士等，悉懷嗔恚咸言：「我等即殺提婆達多。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇas and other householders then became angry and said, We'll kill Devadatta.

source_sentence: 其中有人是提婆達多朋友者，即報提婆達多。
translation: Someone among them is Devadatta's friend, which is the reward of Devadatta.

source_sentence: 提婆達多聞已，即於閑林樹下安禪而住。
translation: After hearing this, Devadatta stayed at the foot of a tree in a quiet forest to meditate.

source_sentence: 時諸婆羅門居士等，見提婆達多在於樹下安禪而住，各相謂曰：「汝等應知，此提婆達多有大威德，我等云何而得殺之？
translation: When the brāhmaṇas and householders saw Devadatta standing quietly in meditation under a tree, they each said to each other, You should know that Devadatta has great authority. How can we kill him?

source_sentence: 云何今我發斯惡事？
translation: How could I have done such a bad thing now?

source_sentence: 宜速各去。」
translation: It's advisable to quickly leave each one.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻聞提婆達多住如是威儀，諸婆羅門居士等雖暫嗔怒而不殺害。
translation: When the monks heard that Devadatta was thus behaving with deportment, the Brāhmaṇas and householders were momentarily angry but didn't kill.

source_sentence: 是諸苾芻咸皆有疑，唯佛世尊能斷疑惑，以緣白佛：「大德世尊！
translation: These monks all had doubts, but only the Bhagavān Buddha was able to remove doubts, so he said to the Buddha for this reason, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今可觀察提婆達多作非法罪，於諸人眾示修善法。」
translation: Now, you can observe that Devadatta commits an unlawful offense and shows people to cultivate good qualities.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「其提婆達多非但今世，作斯非法而現正法，誑惑老鼠以害其命。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, That Devadatta isn't just in this world now that he does this unlawful thing and presents the right teaching, or that he harms a rat by beating it to disturb its life.

source_sentence: 汝等諦聽！
translation: Listen attentively!

source_sentence: 我為汝說。
translation: I'll explain it for you.

source_sentence: 乃往昔時有異方所，有一鼠王與五百鼠為眷屬。
translation: In the distant past, there was a place in another direction where there was a rat king and five hundred rats as his retinue.

source_sentence: 有一猫子名曰火焰，其猫少年之時，所有鼠等悉皆殺害。
translation: There was a cat named Flame of Fire. As the cat was growing up, all the rats and other animals that lived on it were killed as children.

source_sentence: 後年老邁便作是念：『我昔少時氣力強盛，以力捉鼠而食。
translation: Later, old Mai had this thought: Once long ago, when my vitality was strong, I grabbed a rat by force and ate it.

source_sentence: 我今年既朽邁，氣力微薄不能捉獲，設何方便而捉獲鼠？』
translation: Now that I'm so old and feeble this year, my energy is weak and I can't catch it; what method would I use to catch the rat?'

source_sentence: 作是念已遍觀其地，乃見一鼠王與五百鼠而為眷屬住此方所，即就鼠穴詐作坐禪。
translation: After he had this thought, he looked all over the ground and saw a rat king and five hundred rats living here with their retinues, and he sat in meditation fraudulently in a rat's den.

source_sentence: 時諸群鼠出穴遊行，乃見老猫安然坐禪，其鼠問曰：『阿舅！
translation: When the rats emerged from their cave and traveled, they saw an old cat sitting peacefully in meditation, and the rat asked, 'Auntie!

source_sentence: 今何所作？』
translation: What's being done now?'

source_sentence: 老猫答曰：『我昔少年氣力盛壯作無量罪，今欲修福除其舊罪。』
translation: The old cat answered, 'In the past, I was a young boy with great energy and committed measureless sins, but now I want to cultivate goodness to remove my old sins.'

source_sentence: 時群鼠等聞是語已皆發善心：『今此老猫修行善法。』
translation: After hearing these words, the rats and others all aroused good intentions, saying, 'Now, this old cat is cultivating good qualities.'

source_sentence: 即與鼠等右遶老猫，行於三匝便入於穴。
translation: He circled the old cat three times to his right with the rats and so forth, and then entered its burrow.

source_sentence: 其老猫取其最末後者而食，不經多時其鼠漸少。
translation: The old cat took the last one and ate it, but after a long time the rats gradually became less numerous.

source_sentence: 鼠王既見此已便作是念：『我鼠等漸漸數少，其老猫氣力肥盛，是事必有緣由。』
translation: Seeing this, the king of rats then thought,'Gradually, we rats and so forth are few in number, and there must be a reason for that old cat's energy and fatness.'

source_sentence: 其鼠王即便觀察，乃見老猫於其糞中有鼠毛骨。
translation: The king of rats then looked around and saw that the old cat had rat hair and bones in its dung.

source_sentence: 心即知：『老猫食我鼠等，我今深觀捉鼠之時。』
translation: The mind then knew, 'The old cat ate my rats and so forth, and now I'll look deeply into the time when he caught them.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，便即於窟而看老猫，乃見老猫捉最末後鼠而食。
translation: After he had this thought, he looked at the old cat in the cave and saw that the old cat caught the youngest rat and ate it.

source_sentence: 「『老猫身漸肥，　　群鼠積漸少；
translation: 'The old cat' s body grows fat gradually, and the herd of rats increases gradually.

source_sentence: 食苗實根葉，　　糞不應毛骨。
translation: Eating seedlings with real roots and leaves, dung shouldn't be hair or bone.

source_sentence: 汝今修禪不謂善，　　為利詐作修善人；
translation: Now you cultivate meditation and do not call it good. For profit and deceit you become a practitioner of goodness.

source_sentence: 願汝無病安穩住，　　我今群鼠汝食盡。』」
translation: May you be free of illness and stay stable, and now that I'm a group of rats, your food is exhausted.'

source_sentence: 鼠王見已避遠而立，遂說頌曰：佛告諸苾芻：「勿生異念！
translation: Seeing this, the rat king fled and stood at a distance. The Buddha then said in verse: The Buddha told the monks, Do not give rise to strange thoughts!

source_sentence: 時彼火焰老猫者，提婆達多是，作非法罪，於諸人眾示現修善。」
translation: That old cat, Devadatta, who was that old cat in the blazing fire at the time, committed an unlawful offense and showed it to all people to cultivate goodness.

source_sentence: 是諸苾芻咸皆有疑，唯佛世尊能斷疑惑：「大德世尊！
translation: These monks all had doubts, but the Bhagavān was the only one who could remove doubts, saying, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 思審觀察，隨世尊言教者，安穩得度生死。
translation: He reflects and examines, following the Bhagavān's words, he'll be able to save sentient beings from birth and death with stability.

source_sentence: 順提婆達多言教者，遭大苦難。」
translation: Those who follow the words of Devadatta will experience great suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「汝等當知，非但今世隨順我言教者得度生死，往昔亦復如是。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, You should know that not only will those who follow my words and teachings in the present life attain salvation from birth and death, but so it was in the past as well.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻諦聽！
translation: You monks, listen closely!

source_sentence: 諦聽！
translation: Listen attentively!

source_sentence: 我為汝說。
translation: I'll explain it for you.

source_sentence: 乃往昔時有二導師，各有五百車乘過於磧中，或得水草、或不得水草，乃經數日，諸牛犢等極遭苦難。
translation: In the past there were two guides, each with five hundred chariots traveling through the desert in their vehicles. Some of them obtained water and grass, while others did not. After a few days passed, all the cows and calves suffered greatly.

source_sentence: 於後見一方所，其草青茂有多涌泉。
translation: Later, he saw that the grass on one side was so green and luxuriant that there were many well-maintained springs.

source_sentence: 時諸商人將諸牛犢就其水草，時諸商人入水澡浴，飲諸牛犢。
translation: The merchants then put their cows and calves on the water and grass, and the merchants entered the water to bathe and drink the cows and calves.

source_sentence: 既飲水已便息而住。
translation: After he had drunk the water, he stopped and stayed.

source_sentence: 其五百群牛之中有一牛王，告諸牛曰：『此方地所青草欝茂，有好浴泉，我等恣意飲食而住。
translation: Among the five hundred herds of cattle, there was a king ox among them who told the cows, “There is plenty of green grass growing in this place. There is a nice bathing fountain and we are free to eat and drink as we wish.

source_sentence: 若有商人備駕於我，便須臥地不復受使。』
translation: If there are merchants who prepare a carriage for me, then they must lie down on the ground and no longer receive an envoy.'

source_sentence: 第二牛王告群牛曰：『汝等應知！
translation: The second ox king told the herd of cows, 'You should know!'

source_sentence: 其商人等有大氣力，能調伏難調之物，宜可依舊隨順人等般運車乘，恐後有損。』
translation: Those merchants and so forth have great energy, which can subdue things that are difficult to subdue, so it's advisable to follow the old ways of the people and carry the chariot likewise, lest it be harmful later.'

source_sentence: 其大牛王聞是語已，即嗔第二牛王：『汝所言者，依前受他驅使，是事非法。
translation: Having heard these words, the great king of cattle immediately angered the second king of cows, saying: What you have said is that it is unlawful to allow others to expel you based on what you did before.

source_sentence: 豈有人類能見自背。』
translation: How could there be a human being who sees for themselves and turns away?'

source_sentence: 復告群牛曰：『汝等取我言教，不須相去。』
translation: Again, he told the herd of cows, 'Take my words and teachings and don't leave each other.'

source_sentence: 于時商人欲駕其牛，彼諸牛等見商人欲捉，便即瞋怒爮地攫裂。
translation: The merchants then wanted to drive their cattle, but when they saw the merchants wanting to catch them, they grabbed them in anger and tears them apart.

source_sentence: 商人見已，各執棒打，皮穿流血即令駕車。
translation: On seeing him, the merchants each struck him with a stick. His skin pierced his flesh and blood flowed out to make him drive the chariot.

source_sentence: 餘牛牽車而去，皆不被打。
translation: The other cows pulled the cart and departed, but they weren't beaten.

source_sentence: 「『今觀惡牛王，　　妄語行惡行；
translation: 'Now, observe the evil cattle king Who speaks falsely and commits evil deeds.

source_sentence: 諸牛緣此苦，　　飢渴身流血。
translation: Caused by this pain, the cowherds suffered hunger and thirst and bled.

source_sentence: 復觀善牛王，　　淳和出正教；
translation: Again, he observed that the king of good ox-headed One Is pure and harmonious, Producing the true teaching.

source_sentence: 由此諸牛類，　　度險身肥飽。』」
translation: As a result, these cattle will be freed from danger and their bodies fat and full.'

source_sentence: 爾時空中諸天即說頌曰：佛告諸苾芻：「汝等勿生異念，其最勝牛王出正教者，即我身是。
translation: It was then that the gods in the sky spoke a verse, saying, The Buddha told the monks, Don't give rise to different thoughts, for the most excellent cow king who produces the right teaching is me.

source_sentence: 時彼牛王出惡教令，令彼群牛遭苦難者，提婆達多是。
translation: That cow king then issued a bad decree that caused those herds of cattle to experience suffering and distress, Devadatta.

source_sentence: 昔時有能受我教者，皆得安隱，能越危苦諸險難處。
translation: Those who were able to receive my teachings in the past will all attain peace and be able to transcend dangerous and difficult places.

source_sentence: 諸有能受提婆達多言教者，皆遭如是苦難。
translation: Those who can accept the words of Devadatta will all experience such suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 非但往昔，現今能有隨我正見受其教誨，皆得安隱，越度生死煩惱大海。
translation: Not only in the past, but now there are those who follow my right view and receive their instructions, so they'll all attain peace and transcend the great ocean of birth-and-death afflictions.

source_sentence: 若隨順提婆達多耶見惡行，恒遭如是諸大苦難。」
translation: If someone follows the bad actions of Devadatta, they'll always experience such great suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻咸皆有疑。
translation: The monks then all had doubts.

source_sentence: 唯佛能斷，以緣白佛：「唯願世尊！
translation: Only the Buddha can stop it, and he said to the Buddha for this reason, Please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 觀是提婆達多，自身愚癡眷屬亦愚。」
translation: Observing this is Devadatta, his own foolish followers are also foolish.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「提婆達多非但今世愚癡，往時亦然。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, Not only is Devadatta foolish in this world but so was he foolish in the past.

source_sentence: 汝等諦聽！
translation: Listen attentively!

source_sentence: 我為汝說。
translation: I'll explain it for you.

source_sentence: 乃往古昔有一閑靜林野之處，有群獼猴遊住於此。
translation: In ancient times there was a quiet forest and wilderness where many rhesus monkeys lived.

source_sentence: 時諸獼猴遊行漸至一井，乃觀井底見彼月影。
translation: The monkeys then traveled gradually to a well and observed the shadow of the moon at the bottom of the well.

source_sentence: 既見月已詣猴王處，白言：『大王應知！
translation: Seeing the moon, he went to the monkey king's place and said, 'Great king, you should know!'

source_sentence: 其月見墮井中，我等今應速往拔出依舊安置。』
translation: Seeing them fall into a well in the moon, we should now quickly go and pull them out and place them back in the same place.'

source_sentence: 是諸猿猴咸讚言：『善！』
translation: The monkeys and monkeys all praised him, saying, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 便相議曰：『云何方便可能拔月？』
translation: They then conferred with each other, saying, 'How can we skillfully remove the moon?'

source_sentence: 其中或云：『不須餘計，我等連肱為索而拔出之。』
translation: Some of them may say, 'There's no need to make any other calculations; we'll pull it out for a rope and pull it out.'

source_sentence: 時一獼猴在井樹上攀枝而住，其餘一一次第以手相接，獼猴既多，樹枝低下欲折。
translation: One monkey then climbed a branch on top of a well and stayed there. The other monkeys joined it with their hands one after the other, but as there were so many monkeys, the branches fell off and wanted to break.

source_sentence: 時彼最下近水之者攪水覓月，由水渾故月便不現，樹枝便折，一時墮水被溺而死。
translation: The lowest and closest to the water agitates the water and searches for the moon. When the water is overwhelmed, the moon doesn't appear; the branches of the tree break down, and at once they fall into the water and are submerged in it and die.

source_sentence: 「『此諸癡獼猴，　　為彼愚導師；
translation: 'These foolish monkeys are their foolish teachers.

source_sentence: 悉墮於井中，　　救月而溺死。』」
translation: They all fell into a well, saved the moon, and drown themselves.'

source_sentence: 時有諸天而說頌曰：佛告諸苾芻等：「往昔獼猴王者，即提婆達多是。
translation: Some gods then spoke a verse, saying, The Buddha told the monks and others, In the past, that monkey king was Devadatta.

source_sentence: 昔時由自愚癡故，以愚癡而為眷屬，今時亦為愚癡眷屬。」
translation: In the past, they were followers because of their own folly, and now they're also followers of folly.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊在王舍城竹林園中，時世飢儉乞食難得。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was in the bamboo grove in the city of Rājagṛha, and the world was hungry and beggars had difficulty begging for food.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「我欲三月靜住，不得一人輒來見我，除取食者及長淨日。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, I want to stay quietly for three months, so that no one can suddenly come and see me, except for those who take food and those who have a long pure day.

source_sentence: 大德亦應共立明制。」
translation: The great virtuous one should also establish a common set of precepts.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗、摩訶目乾連，在南山內三月安居。
translation: Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana were staying in the southern mountains for three months.

source_sentence: 時提婆達多亦於夏中三月供給飲食及以雜事。
translation: Devadatta also offered food, drink, and miscellaneous services for three months during the summer.

source_sentence: 滿三月已，提婆達多為諸大眾廣說妙法：「苾芻當知！
translation: After three months had passed, Devadatta explained the wonderful teaching to the masses in detail, Monks, you should know!

source_sentence: 沙門喬答摩常說法時，讚歎在山寂靜離諸煩惱解脫最疾最速：一者乞食、二者糞掃衣、三者三衣、四者露坐，如是四人去諸塵垢證得解脫。
translation: When the ascetic Gautama always preached the Dharma, he praised the four kinds of people in the mountains who were tranquil and freed from afflictions and liberation the fastest and quickest: first, those who begged for food, second, those wearing robes made of rags, third, those wearing three-pronged robes, and fourth, seated in the open air. Thus, these four [monks] removed all their dirty clothes and attained liberation.

source_sentence: 若有人不樂如是四種修道、不樂解脫者，即合受籌出離眾外。」
translation: If someone doesn't delight in these four kinds of cultivation and doesn't delight in liberation, then they'll be collected, accepted, and removed from the crowd.

source_sentence: 說此語已，于時大眾五百苾芻人各受籌，隨提婆達多出離眾外行至門首。
translation: After he spoke these words, the five hundred monks in the assembly then each accepted the chips and left Devadatta to go outside the congregation to the entrance of the door.

source_sentence: 羅怙羅見語五百苾芻曰：「云何捨如來隨逐惡黨而去？」
translation: Rāhula saw this and said to the five hundred monks, How did you abandon the Tathāgata and follow a bad party and leave?

source_sentence: 諸苾芻告羅怙羅曰：「我於三月安居飢餓。
translation: The monks told Rāhula, I've been starving for three months in my retreat.

source_sentence: 蒙提婆達多供給取食，并將雜物而供養之。
translation: Mengtibhadra offered food and a variety of things to make offerings to him.

source_sentence: 若不祗濟我等死盡。」
translation: If you don't save us, we'll all die.

source_sentence: 提婆達多分破僧時大地震動，流星晃耀四方火然，一切諸天擊鼓震響高聲唱言：「自今已後涅槃道息，無有得道果者，無有漏盡者，無有讀誦蘇呾羅、毘奈耶、阿毘達磨，心亦不著阿蘭若處，亦無修聲聞辟支佛道者，亦無修阿耨多羅三藐三菩提者，人天浩亂。
translation: When Devadatta partially destroyed the saṃgha, a great earthquake shook, and meteors shone in all four directions with blazing fire. All the gods beat their drums and shouted loudly, saying: From now on, since the path to nirvana has ceased, there will be no one who attains the fruit of the path, no one whose contaminants have been extinguished, no one who recites the sūtra, vinaya, or abhidharma; his mind won't cling to the forest

source_sentence: 三千大千世界法輪不轉，眾生隨人不隨於法。」
translation: The Dharma wheel of the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds doesn't turn, and sentient beings follow people and don't follow the Dharma.

source_sentence: 舍利子、摩訶目揵連見此奇怪，斂心入定，覩見提婆達多破和合僧，便相謂曰：「我等宜往滅諸諍論求令和合。」
translation: Seeing this strange thing, Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana constrained their minds and entered concentration, and when they saw Devadatta break the harmony of the saṃgha, they said to each other, It's advisable for us to go there to extinguish the disputes and seek harmony.

source_sentence: 三月已滿三衣已具，即往世尊所，漸漸遊行詣王舍城竹林園中，安置三衣，洗足已往世尊所。
translation: After three months had passed, the three garments were complete, he went to the Bhagavān, gradually marched to the bamboo grove in Rājagṛha, placed the three garments, and went to the Bhagavān after washing his feet.

source_sentence: 見羅怙羅在門外立，謂舍利子曰：「鄔波馱耶知不？
translation: Seeing Rāhula standing outside the door, he said to Śāriputra, Does Upāsaka know?

source_sentence: 提婆達多已破僧訖。」
translation: Devadatta has destroyed the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 舍利子曰：「我已知訖故為此來，汝勿憂愁，我當和合。」
translation: Śāriputra said, I've come here because I know it's over; don't grieve; I will harmonize with you.

source_sentence: 便入眾中見世尊，稽首頂禮却坐一面，而白佛言：「我聞惡人提婆達多已破僧眾，我欲和合。
translation: He then entered the assembly and saw the Bhagavān, bowed his head in homage, withdrew to one side, and said to the Buddha, I've heard that bad man Devadatta has destroyed the assembly of monks, and I want to reconcile them.

source_sentence: 未審世尊，垂慈許不？」
translation: I'm not sure, Bhagavān, will you grant me your kindness?

source_sentence: 爾時世尊即便歎曰：「善哉，善哉！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān even praised him, Good, good!

source_sentence: 若能如是和合僧者，得福無量。」
translation: If someone can thus harmonize the saṃgha, their merit will be immeasurable.

source_sentence: 時舍利子并大目連，白此事已奉辭世尊，便往南山詣提婆達多所。
translation: Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana then reported this matter to the Bhagavān and after they had given their resignations, they went to Devadatta in the southern mountains.

source_sentence: 時提婆達多作佛威儀為眾說法，孤迦里迦在右邊坐，褰荼達驃居在左邊。
translation: Devadatta then taught the Dharma to the crowd in the Buddha's manner, sitting on the right side with Anāthapiṇḍika alone and Candrabhadra on the left side.

source_sentence: 時提婆達多遙見大德舍利子、目揵連來，便作是念：「我已成一切智人，而此大德入我眾中。」
translation: Devadatta then saw from a distance that the great virtuous Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana had come, and he thought, I've become a man of omniscience, but this great virtuous one has entered my congregation.

source_sentence: 即遣左右侍從令起，即遣舍利子、目健連左右而坐。
translation: He then sent his left and right attendants to rise, and he sent Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana to sit on their left and right.

source_sentence: 時孤迦梨迦、褰荼達驃，既被強移坐處心生瞋恨，善自思惟：「我等有大過失助破僧眾，若欲不起恐被瞋打。」
translation: When the orphaned Kālīyaka and Kauṇḍinya were forcibly displaced to their seats, their minds became angry and resentful, and they well thought to themselves, We have great faults that help break up the saṃgha, and if we don't arise, we'll be afraid of being beaten with anger.

source_sentence: 便即移處，遣大目健連并舍利子居在左右而坐。
translation: He then dismounted, sent Mahāmaudgalyāyana and Śāriputra to sit at his left and right.

source_sentence: 提婆達多告舍利子曰：「我今背痛，汝為大眾演說妙法。」
translation: Devadatta told Śāriputra, Now that I'm suffering from pain in my back, you should explain the wonderful teaching for the masses.

source_sentence: 爾時舍利弗默然受請。
translation: It was then that Śāriputra accepted the invitation by remaining silent.

source_sentence: 提婆達多說此語已，便疊僧伽胝支頭右脇而臥。
translation: After he said these words, Devadatta folded his saṃghâvaśeṣa and lay down on his right side.

source_sentence: 時舍利子以神通力，令遣仰眠不令覺知，告諸大眾：「汝等大師眠如孩兒。」
translation: Śāriputra then, using his supernormal powers, caused the venerable to sleep and didn't let him know it, telling the crowd, You great masters are sleeping like children.

source_sentence: 時舍利子告目連曰：「汝為大眾可速現神通迴心向佛。」
translation: Śāriputra then addressed Maudgalyāyana, For the sake of the masses, you can quickly manifest your supernormal powers and turn your mind back to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 是時大目健連，即便身騰虛空，具四威儀行住坐臥，入火光三昧，放種種光明青黃赤白，或身上出水身下出火，或身上出火身下出水，東西南北具見四種神通。
translation: At the time, Mahāmaudgalyāyana even rose up into space with his body, had four comportments, walked, stood, sat, and lay down, entered the fire-light samādhi, emitted various kinds of light that were blue, yellow, red, and white, or emerged from water on his body beneath his body to produce fire, or emerged from water beneath his body to produce fire, and he saw four kinds of miraculous abilities in the east, west, south, west, north, and west.

source_sentence: 現神通已，從空而下却坐本處。
translation: Having manifested his supernormal powers, he descended from the sky and sat down in his original place.

source_sentence: 是時大眾見大目乾連具此神通，心懷悲惱：「我若侍佛亦應具得神通道德。」
translation: Seeing that Mahāmaudgalyāyana had this miraculous ability, the crowd became sad and distressed, If I were to serve the Buddha, I would also attain the morality of my miraculous abilities.

source_sentence: 舍利子告大眾曰：「諸苾芻！
translation: Śāriputra told the crowd, Monks!

source_sentence: 汝等若於佛世尊所有赤心者，可隨我去。」
translation: If you have red-mindedness in the Bhagavān, you can follow me.

source_sentence: 既聞語已，即隨舍利子後往詣佛所。
translation: Having heard these words, he followed Śāriputra and went to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 僧眾去後，孤迦利迦苾芻，即喚提婆達多起，令趁舍利子。
translation: After the saṃgha departed, the monk Kālīyaka, an orphaned monk, called Devadatta to arise and let him take advantage of Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 時舍利子恐提婆達多不見我徒眾故，必當懊惱吐血而死，遂便漸次緩緩遊行，使提婆達多得見我等。
translation: Fearing that Devadatta wouldn't see us, Śāriputra would surely be distressed and spit out blood and die, so he gradually traveled slowly in order so that Devadatta could see us.

source_sentence: 于時提婆達多從睡起已，拭眼而趁。
translation: Devadatta then got up from sleep, wiped his eyes, and took advantage of it.

source_sentence: 舍利子以神通力當路作大深坑，提婆達多、孤迦利迦、褰荼達驃等五人，不覺墮坑，迷亂不知出處。
translation: Śāriputra used his supernormal powers to create a large and deep pit on the road, but Devadatta, Anāthapiṇḍika, Kāndadatta, and five others didn't feel like falling into a pit, and they were confused and didn't know where to exit.

source_sentence: 復自思惟：「我今既失徒眾，莫知尋覓且歸本處。」
translation: Again, he thought to himself, Now that I've lost my followers, I don't know how to search and return to my original place.

source_sentence: 時舍利子、目健連及諸僧眾，漸詣佛所，到闌鐸迦竹林園邊欲見世尊，極大羞慚不能舉目，各自思惟：「我等云何作如是非法無慚愧事？」
translation: Śāriputra, Maudgalyāyana, and the other monks then gradually approached the Buddha and went to the side of the bamboo grove in Bimbisāra to see the Bhagavān, but they were so ashamed that they couldn't raise their eyes, each thinking, How did we do such an unlawful and shameless act?

source_sentence: 漸詣佛前而立。
translation: He gradually approached the Buddha and stood there.

source_sentence: 時世尊大慈憐愍軟聲慰問：「汝等苾芻！
translation: The Bhagavān then had great compassion and a soft voice to comfort them, saying, You monks!

source_sentence: 極大疲勞來至我所。
translation: They're extremely exhausted and come to me.

source_sentence: 今者人身難得已得，佛法難聞已聞，六根難具已具，善惡之事已具知之。
translation: Now, it's difficult to obtain a human body, the Buddha's teaching is hard to hear and has been heard, the six faculties are hard to fulfill and have been fulfilled, and good and bad deeds are fully known.

source_sentence: 我已成就如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，我常演說寂靜涅槃究竟菩提，說無明緣行、行緣識、識緣名色、名色緣六入、六入緣觸、觸緣受、受緣愛、愛緣取、取緣有、有緣生、生緣老死憂悲苦惱。
translation: I've accomplished the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Enlightened, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well-gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed, Tamer of Men, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, Bhagavān, I've always taught that quiescent nirvāṇa is the ultimate enlightenment, saying that nescience is conditioned by volition, volition is conditioned by consciousness, name form is conditioned by consciousness, name form is conditioned by name form

source_sentence: 若無明滅則行滅、行滅則識滅、識滅則名色滅、名色滅則六入滅、六入滅則觸滅、觸滅則受滅、受滅則愛滅、愛滅則取滅、取滅則有滅、有滅則生滅、生滅則老死滅、老死滅則憂悲苦惱滅。
translation: If nescience ceases, then form ceases; if form ceases, then consciousness ceases; if consciousness ceases, then name-and-form ceases; if name-and-form ceases, then the six sense-fields cease; if the six sense-fields cease, then contact ceases; if contact ceases, then sensation ceases; if sensation ceases, then craving ceases; if craving ceases, then grasping ceases; if grasping ceases, then birth ceases; if birth ceases, then

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 常思修學自利利他。
translation: He always thinks about cultivating self-benefiting and benefiting others.

source_sentence: 自利利他之法：若法不善無利無樂究竟不善，及於他四輩所得飲食、衣服、臥具、湯藥自身不善之事，不應作者莫作；但觀自身及他有利益者，常須修學。」
translation: Self-benefiting and other-benefiting dharmas: If a dharma is unwholesome, unbeneficial, and unattractive, it's ultimately unwholesome, and the food, clothing, bedding, bathing, and self-unwholesome things that are obtained by the four groups of others shouldn't be created or done; but those who observe themselves and others for their own benefit always need to cultivate training.

source_sentence: 于時諸苾芻等聞此法已，心生歡喜疑網皆除，內外清淨。
translation: When the monks and others heard this teaching, their minds were filled with joy and their web of doubt was all removed, and they were pure inside and out.

source_sentence: 有異苾芻等心生疑惑而問：「世尊！
translation: Some different monks and others had doubts in their minds and asked, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 有何因業，今被破和合僧！」
translation: What's the reason why they're now broken and united with the saṃgha!

source_sentence: 佛為諸苾芻說過去業：「我自聚集作業今自受之，非是他受。
translation: The Buddha told the monks about past actions, saying, I gathered my own actions and now accept them for myself, not others.

source_sentence: 苾芻當知！
translation: You should know, monks!

source_sentence: 有情作業還有情受，非無情受。」
translation: The actions of sentient beings are received by sentient beings and not by insentient beings.

source_sentence: 「假令經百劫，　　所作業不亡；
translation: Even if it were to pass for a hundred eons, Their deeds wouldn’t perish.

source_sentence: 因緣會遇時，　　果報還自受。」
translation: When the causes and conditions meet, the result will be experienced on its own.

source_sentence: 而說頌曰：爾時世尊告諸苾芻：「乃往過去清淨山林有一大仙，五百小仙以為眷屬，俱共修道。
translation: He spoke a verse, saying, The Bhagavān then addressed the monks, In the past, there was a great sage in the pure forest of mountains who had five hundred lesser sages as their retinues and cultivated together.

source_sentence: 時有客仙來過其所，主人不與如法供給看侍。
translation: A guest sage then came and passed by him, but the host didn't provide an attendant in accordance with the rules.

source_sentence: 客仙心生懊惱而恨，便破和合仙眾，誘引彼諸小仙言：『我善解種種道術及五神通，我當教示，汝當隨我。』
translation: The guest sage became distressed and resented it, so he defeated the assembled sages and enticed those lesser sages, saying, 'I well understand the various techniques of the path and the five supernormal powers; I will teach them to you, and you will follow me.'

source_sentence: 後時大仙知此事已，勸彼客仙：『莫破我眾，非是仙法。』
translation: Knowing this, the great sage then exhorted the guest sage, 'Don't break through with us; it's not the way of the sage.'

source_sentence: 巧說善言令生歡喜，雖得如是滅諍之語，由勸不息設方便。
translation: He skillfully speaks good words to make them rejoice, and even though he obtains this kind of speech that extinguishes anger, he establishes skillful means by encouraging it without ceasing.

source_sentence: 時世有辟支佛，有大慈悲，少欲知足上勝福田，遊行世間漸詣仙所。
translation: At the time, there was a pratyekabuddha in the world who possessed great compassion and had few desires and cravings that were superior to the field of merit. He traveled throughout the world and gradually arrived at the sage's place.

source_sentence: 大仙見辟支佛端嚴殊勝，心生歡喜供養恭敬，而發願言：『以此供養佛功德，願我當來得大智慧神通之力。
